Milošević o utakmici i rasizmu, Tošić najavio borbu [VIDEO]
06 Nov 2019, 21:21 by Milos
Partizan gostuje Mančester Junajtedu na Old Trafordu u utakmici četvrtog kola L grupe Lige šampiona. Susret je na programu u četvrtak, 7. novembra od 21 čas.
Trener Partizana Savo Milošević očekuje težak susret i naglašava da je recept igra iz Beograda, kada je Partizan bio ravnopravan protivnik engleskom velikanu i pored minimalnog poraza.
– Očekuje nas dosta teža utakmica nego u Beogradu i moramo da budemo spremni na tako nešto. Pokušaćemo da ispariramo Mančesteru kao u Beogradu, i ako to učinimo možemo da očekujemo povoljan rezultat, rekao je trener crno-belih.
Britanski novinar je insistirao sa pitanjem o rasizmu u Srbiji, a Milošević je imao spreman odgovor.
– Još jednom naglašavam da u Srbiji nemamo problem sa rasizmom. Podsetiću vas da sam 14 godina igrao u inostranstvu, igrao sam brojem fudbalera različitih vera i nacija, i zalažem se za demokratiju u zemlji u kojoj živim, u za mene je svaki vid diskriminacije neprihvatljiv. Vratio sam se po završetku karijere igračke karijere u Srbiju i uveravam vas da nemamo problem sa rasizmom, dodao je Milošević.
Zoran Tošić najavljuje veliku borbu protiv bivšeg kluba.
– Srećni smo što imamo priliku da igramo protiv velikog protivnika. Analizirali smo ih, sigurno su drugačija ekipa kod kuće. Imamo motivacije i želje da ostvarimo dobar rezultat, kazao je Tošić i podsetio se vremena u slavnom engleskom klubu.

Milosevic on match and racism, Tosic announces fight [VIDEO]
06 Nov 2019, 21:21 by Milos
Partizan host Manchester United at Old Traford in the fourth round of the Champions League Group L group. The meeting is on the program on Thursday, November 7 from 9 pm.
Partizan coach Savo Milosevic expects a difficult encounter and stresses that the recipe is a game from Belgrade, when Partizan was an equal opponent to the English great despite minimal defeat.
- We are expecting a much harder game than in Belgrade and we have to be prepared for something like that. We will try to evaporate Manchester like in Belgrade, and if we do, we can expect a favorable result, said the coach of black and whites.
A British journalist insisted on the question of racism in Serbia, and Milosevic had a ready answer.
- Once again, I emphasize that we have no problem with racism in Serbia. I will remind you that I have played abroad for 14 years, I have played with a number of football players of different faiths and nations, and I advocate democracy in the country where I live, to me every form of discrimination is unacceptable. I returned after finishing my playing career in Serbia and I assure you that we have no problem with racism, added Milosevic.
Zoran Tosic announces a big fight against the former club.
- We are fortunate to have the opportunity to play against a great opponent. We analyzed them, they are certainly a different team at home. We have the motivation and the desire to achieve a good result, said Tosic and recalled the time at the famous English club.
